result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay court costs within 60 or spend 5 days in jail consecutive.

After defendant serves 15 days, the defendant is granted huber for work.  Do not report in late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances.  Absolute sobriety required.
Appeal rights given.
Defendant is given a $1,000.00 fine plus court costs.  DNA surcharge is not applicable.   60 days to pay.  FTP will result in 90 days jail consecutive to ct. 1.  Appeal rights given.

Preliminary hearing on December 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim K.L. (person, property, residence or family).  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
